paragraphs.text:
%md
Based on <https://academy.datastax.com/resources/getting-started-time-series-data-modeling>

Needs Cassandra to be up-and-running

> dcos package install cassandra

and Zeppelin Interpreter for Cassandra to point to a node using mesos

> cassandra.hosts: node-0.cassandra.mesos,node-1.cassandra.mesos,node-2.cassandra.mesos

result.msg:

and Zeppelin Interpreter for Cassandra to point to a node using mesos

paragraphs.title: Time Series Pattern 1- Single Device per Row

result.msg:
No Result


Last query execution info
Info Value
Statement CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS weatherdata.temperature ( weatherstation_id text, event_time timestamp, temperature text, PRIMARY KEY (weatherstation_id,event_time) );
Achieved Consistency N/A
Tried Hosts node-2.cassandra.mesos10.0.5.97:9042
Queried Hosts node-2.cassandra.mesos10.0.5.97:9042
Schema In Agreement true

• DESCRIBE TABLE temperature;
  • Legend
    •  Cluster

 temperature
Column Type Column Name Data Type
weatherstation_id text
  event_time timestamp
temperature text
As CQL statement 

CREATE TABLE weatherdata.temperature (
    weatherstation_id text,
    event_time timestamp,
    temperature text,
    PRIMARY KEY (weatherstation_id, event_time)
) WITH read_repair_chance = 0.0
   AND dclocal_read_repair_chance = 0.1
   AND gc_grace_seconds = 864000
   AND bloom_filter_fp_chance = 0.01
   AND caching = { 'keys' : 'ALL', 'rows_per_partition' : 'NONE' }
   AND comment = ''
   AND compaction = { 'class' : 'org.apache.cassandra.db.compaction.SizeTieredCompactionStrategy', 'max_threshold' : 32, 'min_threshold' : 4 }
   AND compression = { 'chunk_length_in_kb' : 64, 'class' : 'org.apache.cassandra.io.compress.LZ4Compressor' }
   AND default_time_to_live = 0
   AND speculative_retry = '99PERCENTILE'
   AND min_index_interval = 128
   AND max_index_interval = 2048
   AND crc_check_chance = 1.0;

paragraphs.title: Now we can insert a few data points for our weather station:

result.msg:
No Result


Last query execution info
Info Value
Statement INSERT INTO temperature(weatherstation_id,event_time,temperature) VALUES ('1234ABCD','2013-04-03 07:04:00','74F');
Achieved Consistency N/A
Tried Hosts node-0.cassandra.mesos10.0.7.51:9042
Queried Hosts node-0.cassandra.mesos10.0.7.51:9042
Schema In Agreement true

paragraphs.title: A simple query looking for all data on a single weather station:
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra
SELECT event_time,temperature
FROM temperature
WHERE weatherstation_id='1234ABCD';

result.msg:
event_time	temperature
Wed Apr 03 07:01:00 UTC 2013	72F
Wed Apr 03 07:02:00 UTC 2013	73F
Wed Apr 03 07:03:00 UTC 2013	73F
Wed Apr 03 07:04:00 UTC 2013	74F

paragraphs.title: A range query looking for data between two dates. This is also known as a slice since it will read a sequence of data from disk:
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra
SELECT temperature
FROM temperature
WHERE weatherstation_id='1234ABCD'
AND event_time > '2013-04-03 07:01:00'
AND event_time < '2013-04-03 07:04:00';

paragraphs.title: Time Series Pattern 2 - Partitioning to Limit Row Size

result.msg:
No Result


Last query execution info
Info Value

Queried Hosts node-1.cassandra.mesos10.0.4.234:9042
Schema In Agreement true

paragraphs.text:
%cassandra
CREATE TABLE temperature_by_day (
weatherstation_id text,
date text,
event_time timestamp,
temperature text,
PRIMARY KEY ((weatherstation_id,date),event_time)
);

 temperature_by_day
Column Type Column Name Data Type
weatherstation_id text
date text
  event_time timestamp
temperature text
As CQL statement 

CREATE TABLE weatherdata.temperature_by_day (
    weatherstation_id text,
    date text,
    event_time timestamp,
    temperature text,
    PRIMARY KEY ((weatherstation_id, date), event_time)
) WITH read_repair_chance = 0.0
   AND dclocal_read_repair_chance = 0.1
   AND gc_grace_seconds = 864000
   AND bloom_filter_fp_chance = 0.01
   AND caching = { 'keys' : 'ALL', 'rows_per_partition' : 'NONE' }
   AND comment = ''
   AND compaction = { 'class' : 'org.apache.cassandra.db.compaction.SizeTieredCompactionStrategy', 'max_threshold' : 32, 'min_threshold' : 4 }
   AND compression = { 'chunk_length_in_kb' : 64, 'class' : 'org.apache.cassandra.io.compress.LZ4Compressor' }
   AND default_time_to_live = 0
   AND speculative_retry = '99PERCENTILE'
   AND min_index_interval = 128
   AND max_index_interval = 2048
   AND crc_check_chance = 1.0;

Note the (weatherstation_id,date) portion. When we do that in the PRMARY KEY definition, the key will be compounded with the two elements. Now when we insert data, the key will group all weather data for a single day on a single row.

%md
Note the (weatherstation_id,date) portion. When we do that in the PRMARY KEY definition, the key will be compounded with the two elements. Now when we insert data, the key will group all weather data for a single day on a single row.

paragraphs.text:
%cassandra
SELECT *
FROM temperature_by_day
WHERE weatherstation_id='1234ABCD'
AND date='2013-04-03';

paragraphs.title: Time Series Pattern 3 - Reverse Order Timeseries with Expiring Columns

result.msg:
No Result


Last query execution info
Info Value
Statement CREATE TABLE latest_temperatures ( weatherstation_id text, event_time timestamp, temperature text, PRIMARY KEY (weatherstation_id,event_time), ) WITH CLUSTERING ORDER BY (event_time DESC);
Achieved Consistency N/A
Tried Hosts node-0.cassandra.mesos10.0.7.51:9042
Queried Hosts node-0.cassandra.mesos10.0.7.51:9042
Schema In Agreement true

paragraphs.text:
%cassandra
CREATE TABLE latest_temperatures (
weatherstation_id text,
event_time timestamp,
temperature text,
PRIMARY KEY (weatherstation_id,event_time),
) WITH CLUSTERING ORDER BY (event_time DESC);

paragraphs.title: Now when we insert data. Note the TTL of 20 which means the data will expire in 20 seconds:

result.msg:
No Result


Last query execution info
Info Value
Statement INSERT INTO latest_temperatures(weatherstation_id,event_time,temperature) VALUES ('1234ABCD','2013-04-03 07:04:00','74F') USING TTL 20;
